results.brief_description: Panoramic view of New York City, including scenes of the skyline, skyscrapers, Gramercy Park, the United Nations, the Museum, Greenwich Village, Rockefeller Center and the night spots.

results.title: New worlds for old
results.creator_credit: Maslyn Williams and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: A survey of the progress being made in Papua and New Guinea, showing new industries, new roads and means of transport, the introduction of sheep, cattle and goats, and the way in which the natives are being encouraged to cooperate in these activities.

results.title: New ways with wool
results.creator_credit: Shan Benson, Les Davidson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The production of many new types of synthetic fibres is a threat to the future of the Australian wool industry - the chemist is producing new materials more closely resembling the characteristics of wool. This film, showing how the wool industry is meeting this challenge, is an account of the work being done at various research centres throughout the Commonwealth, investigating and improving the production, processing, and use of wool.

results.title: New universities
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Look at Life”.
A survey of the new universities program which seeks to extend facilities for university training in England. Taking the University of Sussex as the principal example, the film gives a picture of student life and activities in the fine modern buildings designed by Sir Basil Spence.

results.title: New town
results.creator_credit: John Halas, Joy Batchelor and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description: A cartoon film explaining the need for town planning to avoid a repetition of past mistakes. Diagrams illustrate how towns have grown without provision being made for proper transport, for the separation of industrial and residential areas and the provision of playgrounds and conveniently situated shopping centres.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Halas, Joy Batchelor and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films

results.title: New tasks for Japan
results.brief_description: Surveys the social, political and economic changes in Japan since 1945 leading to a new role in Asia, providing technical assistance to less developed nations.

results.title: New sounds in music
results.creator_credit: Pieter Van Deusen and Churchill Films
results.brief_description: Presents fascinating new sounds and new ways of treating old sounds. Chance music, tape music, synthesiser music, and other 20th century approaches are heard. Some newly invented string and percussion instruments are demonstrated and finally we go to the Mills College Tape Music Center for a presentation involving new instruments, musicians and “new” music.

results.title: New romance
results.creator_credit: Janet Walczewski, Susan Gabori, Bill Brind and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Finely drawn study of the social aspects of heterosexual and homosexual relationships and asks whether people have a right to think, feel and act differently. Excellent use of locational interviews, cartoons and meaningful dialogue and opens up a subject that is often misunderstood.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Janet Walczewski, Susan Gabori, Bill Brind and ONF | NFB
